location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter no.138 of 1850 from Lieutenant-Colonel Samuel Hennell, Resident in the Persian Gulf, to Arthur Malet, Chief Secretary to the Government Bombay

mods.abstract: The letter conveys the details of a report received from the Native Agent at Muscat [Khojah Hiskal], concerning the seizure of Syed Humood ben Azan [Said Hamood bin Azan] of Sohar [Suhar] by the Sultan of Muscat Syed Soweynee [Thuwaini bin Said]. Thuwaini bin Said is reported to have demanded the surrender of Suhar and its dependencies, in return for Said Hamood's freedom.
